meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tame.
meanings.sent1: The tamenesses of the pet rabbit made it easy to handle.
meanings.sent2: The tamenesses of the dog allowed it to play well with children.
meanings.sent3: The tamenesses of the squirrel surprised the forest animals.
meanings.sent4: The tamenesses of the lion in captivity were a stark contrast to its wild nature.
meanings.sent5: The tamenesses of the horse were evident in its gentle demeanor.

meanings.definition: The act or process of making something tame.
meanings.sent1: Her tamenesses of the wild horse took months of patient training.
meanings.sent2: The tamenesses of the wild bear required careful handling by the zookeepers.
meanings.sent3: The tamenesses of the wild cat after being tamed amused the circus audience.
meanings.sent4: The tamenesses of the wild elephant showed the success of the trainer's methods.
meanings.sent5: The tamenesses of the wild bird after rehabilitation was a heartwarming sight.
